channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Yes, You Can Now Bet on Elections in the US
item.description: A US judge has overturned a moratorium that stopped gambling companies from letting people bet on election results.

item.title: Australian plan for misinformation law riles Elon Musk
item.description: The Australian government wants to introduce powers to fine social media platforms up to 5% of their global revenue if they fail to stop the spread of...

item.title: How to Set Up Your New TV
item.description: You got a new TV! Here's how to make it sing.

item.title: Amazon and Flipkart violated competition laws in India, report says
item.description: Indian antitrust regulator has found that Amazon and Flipkart, owned by Walmart, violated local competition laws, according to a report. The finding p...

item.title: Lockly Visage Zeno Series Smart Lock Review: Infrared Sensors for Face Detection
item.description: This smart lock uses infrared sensors to see me coming, recognize my face, and unlock the front door.

item.title: Tune.FM wants to take on Spotify by using crypto to pay artists up to 100x more per stream
item.description: Tune.FM is a decentralized music streaming service where users pay for each song they stream using Tune.FM's crypto token JAM. © 2024 TechCrunch. All ...

item.title: Amazon’s Shipping and Delivery Emissions Just Keep Going Up
item.description: A new report attempts to calculate how much damage shipping our Amazon orders is doing to the planet and how badly the company is missing its own targ...

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: The latest SpaceX mission saw the first private spacewalk

item.title: 16 Best Cozy Games (2024), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Forget stressful leaderboards and time-sensitive missions. These games let you play at your own pace.

item.title: Google DeepMind teaches a robot to autonomously tie its shoes and fix fellow robots
item.description: DeepMind employed a new learning platform, ALOHA Unleashed, paired with its simulation program, DemoStart, to teach robots by watching humans. © 2024 ...
